meanings.definition: To burn slightly or to char
meanings.sent1: I accidentally charked the toast this morning.
meanings.sent2: The chef will chark the steak to perfection on the grill.
meanings.sent3: The marshmallow charked quickly over the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the paper started to chark under the intense heat.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to chark the wood while roasting marshmallows.

meanings.sent1: The firefighter found a piece of chark in the burnt building.
meanings.sent2: The artist used chark to create a unique texture in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chark from the fire pit was used to start the next fire.
meanings.sent4: The ancient scroll showed signs of chark along the edges.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist discovered a fragment of chark in the ruins.
